title: Sejong the Great
summary: Sejong the Great (세종대왕, Korean pronunciation: [se̞(ː)dzo̞ŋ]; 15 May 1397 – 8 April 1450) was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty of Korea. He was the third son of King Taejong from Queen Wongyeong, and was designated as Crown Prince after his older brother, Grand Prince Yangnyeong, was stripped of his title. He ascended to the throne in 1418, but during the first four years of his reign, Taejong governed as regent and executed Sejong's father-in-law, Sim On, and his close associates.
